data.quote: A successful man is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at him.
data.author: David Brinkley

data.quote: Defeat is not the worst of failures. Not to have tried is the true failure.
data.author: George Edward Woodberry

data.quote: If at first, you don’t succeed, try, try again. Then quit. There’s no point in being a damn fool about it.
data.author: W.C. Fields

data.quote: Any change, even a change for the better, is always accompanied by drawbacks and discomforts.
data.author: Arnold Bennett

data.quote: If you don’t like something, change it. If you can’t change it, change your attitude.
data.author: Maya Angelou

data.quote: All men of action are dreamers.
data.author: James Huneker

data.quote: If we were to select the most intelligent, imaginative, energetic, and emotionally stable third of mankind, all races would be present
data.author: Franz Boas

data.quote: Be more concerned with your character than your reputation, because your character is what you really are, while your reputation is merely what others think you are.
data.author: John Wooden

data.quote: You grow up the day you have your first real laugh at yourself .
data.author: Ethel Barrymore

data.quote: There is nothing stronger in the world than gentleness.
data.author: Han Suyin

data.quote: Truth becomes untruth if uttered by your enemy.
data.author: George Orwell

data.quote: honestly think it is better to be a failure at something you love than to be a success at something you hate.
data.author: George Burns

data.quote: The purpose of life is a life of purpose.
data.author: Robert Byrne
